Utterance: Hi! It’s good to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie. Honestly, it’s been a bit of a rollercoaster. I’ve had some good days, but the stress is still there.
I appreciate your honesty. What do you think has contributed to the good days?
I’ve been trying to stick to my morning routine and the breathing exercises we talked about.
That’s fantastic to hear! How has that impacted your mood?
I think it helps a little. I feel more grounded, but it’s still tough when work gets hectic.
It sounds like you’re making progress, even if it’s not perfect. What has been the most challenging part of your routine?
I still forget to do the exercises sometimes, especially when I’m busy.
That’s understandable. Would it help to make those exercises a non-negotiable part of your morning?
Yeah, I think so. Maybe I could set a specific time for them.
That sounds like a solid plan. You could also try pairing it with another habit, like brushing your teeth or drinking your coffee.
I’ll definitely give that a try.
Great! Now, how about your conversations with your friends? Have you had a chance to talk to them about how you’ve been feeling?
Yes, I talked to my best friend, and it went surprisingly well. He was really supportive.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel to open up to him?
It felt good, actually. I was nervous at first, but it was nice to share what I’ve been going through.
I’m glad you found it helpful. It can be a relief to share your feelings with someone who understands. Did he offer any advice or insights?
He just reminded me that it’s okay to ask for help and that I’m not alone in this.
That’s valuable advice. It’s important to remember that everyone struggles at times. How has that perspective shifted your feelings about reaching out?
I think I’m feeling more open to it now. I realize it’s not a burden.
That’s a positive change! Let’s talk about your goals again. Have you made any progress on researching businesses or networking?
I started looking into some online resources, and I joined a couple of forums. It feels good to take those steps.
That’s excellent! It sounds like you’re making strides toward your dream. How do you feel about the progress you’re making?
I feel more motivated, actually. It’s nice to have something to focus on outside of work stress.
That’s wonderful to hear! Focusing on your goals can provide a sense of purpose. Is there anything specific you’d like to explore regarding your business ideas?
I’d like to brainstorm some ideas and maybe figure out what steps I need to take next.
Absolutely! We can outline some actionable steps for you to take. What type of business are you most interested in?
I’m really interested in starting an online business, maybe something related to fitness or wellness.
That aligns well with your interests! Have you thought about what niche you’d like to focus on within that area?
I’m not entirely sure yet. Maybe something that combines fitness with mental wellness?
That sounds like a valuable niche, especially given your experiences. You could explore creating content around that theme or even offering coaching services.
That’s a great idea! I hadn’t thought of coaching.
It could be fulfilling to share your journey and help others. Would you like to explore how you could start small with that?
Yes, I’d love to!
We could brainstorm some content ideas or even consider starting a blog or social media presence to share your insights.
That sounds doable. I think I could start with social media.
Perfect! Social media can be a powerful platform to connect with others. How do you feel about sharing your experiences there?
I feel a bit nervous, but I also think it could be really rewarding.
It’s completely normal to feel nervous. Remember, you can start small and gradually share more as you feel comfortable.
That makes sense. I’ll keep that in mind.
Fantastic! For our next session, we can check in on your progress with the exercises, your networking efforts, and how you’re feeling overall.
Sounds good to me. I’m looking forward to it.
Me too! Keep taking care of yourself, and remember to reach out if you need support.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate everything.
You’re welcome! See you next time!
